text: schoolgirls in carbon rehearsing for the
Capitals football tournament this was
inconceivable when the Taliban were in
power but in the past 20 years women
have fought to get many of their rights
back
however this generation tell me they are
unsure what peace with the Taliban will
bring I sure it's all about change so we
can't change all the food lights all of
people and this is my big wish we have a
stress they didn't don't leave us to
play football or go to school or improve
our knowledge the highest ranking female
security official in the country meeting
a large gathering of women training to
be police officers another impossible
scene when the Taliban were in power
cosna Jaleel is hopeful the clerk cannot
be turned back even if Taliban would
join us we will still have a legitimate
state with all its values and we are
here to protect and defend the values we
have defended so far we will still move
on and we will not get back to where we
have been in the last 17 to 18 years
under the Taliban the rights of women
and girls were severely restricted aside
from not being allowed to study work or
play sport they were also banned from
showing their faces in public this is
the house of political and within the
Taliban Minister for the promotion of
virtue and the prevention of Vice on his
orders television sets were broken music
was banned and as were pictures of any
living thing but now he has a flat
screen in his guest room and a picture
of his in a corner which was taken I
believe well before the Taliban regime
the man responsible for whipping women
and the streets if they showed their
faces in public tells me the Taliban
have indeed changed who are you to
bother those days are gone they will not
be repeated
I assured the people of Afghanistan
especially the woman of Kabul but there
will be no more whipping
although the Taliban is open to
recognizing the rights of women it
remains to be seen just how far they are
prepared to go meanwhile peace is still
some way off
it will require negotiated settlements
between many parties early atrophy BBC
